snippet: Legislators have agreed to normalize ties for the first time in decades, but the move to impose sanctions defies President Obama, who lobbied against mixing the issues.
abstract: Bipartisan coalition in Congress has agreed to normalize trade relations with Russia, the onetime adversary in the long struggle between capitalism and communism; at a time of renewed tension with Moscow, lawmakers have decided to grant the status with the caveat that Russian officials be held responsible for human rights abuses; President Obama had lobbied against mixing the issues.
lead_paragraph: Legislators have agreed to normalize ties for the first time in decades, but the move to impose sanctions defies President Obama, who lobbied against mixing the issues.

headline.seo: After Decades, U.S. to Extend Trade Deal to Russia
headline.main: In Trade Deal With Russia, U.S. Plans Sanctions for Human Rights Abuses
headline.print_headline: In Trade Deal With Russia, U.S. Plans Sanctions for Human Rights Abuses

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
